page.title: 15WAR MEMORIAL ROW IN IBSTOCK
page.content: Ibstock villagers held a special meeting to decide the future of the war memorial in Central Avenue. Parish councillor Mr Vic Price wanted the monument moved from its position in the centre of the road at the entrance to the community college to a better site, either the cemetery or land in Jacques Street. He complained that the memorial, which bears more than 120 names of lives lost in the First and Second World Wars, was used as an unofficial keep left sign and toilet. Buses also had difficulty getting into the High School car park. Mr Price argued that the cemetery would be an ideal place for the memorial as it contained 12 war graves. The meeting decided, however, that the memorial should stay where it is.
